IIT= Indian Institute of Technology There are 23 IITs in India out of which only 5 are prominent. To get admission in an IIT, one has to crack an exam called “JEE Advanced” which happens to be the world’s second toughest exam. Students spend years preparing for it. Out the 1.5 million students who take the exam every year, only 4000 qualify for the prominent IITs. The syllabus is humongous, competition cut-throat, stress lethal and difficulty level is insane. Only the best minds of the country are selected in IITs. And these students are called IITians.

Stands for Indian Institute of Technology Joint entrance Examination .This examination is conducted every year in the last week of May and is one of the toughest in the world. Cracking this examination makes you fall under the category of few bright minds of India and gives you the privilege of getting a B-tech or a M- tech degree also if you take a 5 yr course in Engineering. IIT’s are the most sought after colleges in India which give engineering degree to only 12000 students in the whole country.
